data.title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island today
data.byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers will occur at times in Eastern, Northern, North-central, Central and Uva provinces and in Hambantota district today (22).

data.title: Trump says he would sanction Russia if Putin does not negotiate on Ukraine
data.byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he would likely impose sanctions on Russia if its president, Vladimir Putin, refuses to negotiate about ending the war in Ukraine.

data.title: UNP and SJB talks: Parties agree to contest elections under unified banner
data.byline: The first round of talks between the United National Party (UNP) and the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) to explore the possibility of working together in the future, has been successful.

data.title: Irish national arrested with Hashish and Kush at airport
data.byline: A foreign national who was in the possession of narcotics including Hashish and Kush cannabis has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake.

data.title: Sri Lanka to import coconut?
data.byline: The Ceylon Chamber of Coconut Industries has urged the government for permission to import 200 million coconuts with the next few months.

data.title: World Bank Vice President and Sri Lankan PM discuss key development priorities
data.byline: Vice President for the South Asia Region of the World Bank Martin Raiser paid a courtesy call on Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya at the Parliament of Sri Lanka to discuss the country‚Äôs key development priorities.

data.title: Netflix raises prices after reporting its biggest-ever subscriber jump
data.byline: Netflix announced Tuesday it will raise prices on most of its subscription tiers in the US and Canada after the streaming giant reported 19 million new subscribers in the last quarter of 2024.

data.title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
data.byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Eastern, North-central and Uva provinces and in Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Hambantota districts today (21), the Department of Meteorology said.

data.title: President to visit Middle East in Feb; Reveals future plans to export petroleum
data.byline: While highlighting plans to embark on an official visit to the Middle East in February, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake outlined that the discussions will aim to bolster Sri Lanka‚Äôs energy and economic sectors.

data.title: Govt to provide vehicles for all MPs; No more permits - Vijitha Herath
data.byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath states that the government plans to provide vehicles for all 225 Members of Parliament in the near future.

data.title: Adverse weather impacts 15 districts, over 20,000 persons affected
data.byline: The prevailing adverse weather conditions have severely affected 15 districts across the island, displacing thousands and causing significant disruptions.

data.title: Trump signs executive order withdrawing from World Health Organization
data.byline: The United States will exit the World Health Organization, President Donald Trump said on Monday, saying the global health agency had mishandled the COVID-19 pandemic and other international health crises.

data.title: Trains delayed on coastal line
data.byline: The train services on the coastal line will experience delays, owing to damage to the railway track at Dehiwela, Sri Lanka Railways announced.

data.title: Lasith Malinga launches book titled ‚ÄòKiller‚Äô on the art of fast bowling
data.byline: Sri Lanka‚Äôs legendary fast bowler Lasith Malinga unveiled his maiden book, titled "Killer", at a grand launch event held in Colombo yesterday afternoon (20).

data.title: MP Archchuna clashes with traffic police in A‚Äôpura
data.byline: The three-member special committee appointed to investigate into the allegations against Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna is scheduled to convene at the Parliament complex at 11.00 a.m. today (21).

data.title: Parliamentary session begins
data.byline: The Parliamentary session commenced at 09.30 a.m. today (January 21).

data.title: NPP MPs‚Äô allowances directed to common bank account for public service
data.byline: Deputy Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Sunil Watagala says that the allowances of all Members of Parliament (MPs) representing the National People‚Äôs Power (NPP) will be credited to a single bank account.

data.title: Colombo Fort railway station‚Äôs train timetable revised
data.byline: The timetable for trains operating from the Colombo Fort Railway Station has been revised.

data.title: Sri Lanka to hold first-ever conference of MPs with disabilities
data.byline: The Chief Observer of the European Union Election Observation Mission, Jose Ignacio Sanchez Amor, Member of the European Parliament, and his delegation met with Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne at Parliament recently.

data.title: After taking office, Trump pardons 1,500 Jan. 6 defendants
data.byline: Donald Trump pardoned about 1,500 of his supporters who attacked the U.S. Capitol four years ago as he moved swiftly to impose his will on the U.S. government just hours after reclaiming the presidency on Monday.

data.title: Police launch investigation into MP Archchuna‚Äôs clash with traffic cops
data.byline: Police have launched an investigation into the alleged altercation involving Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna and traffic police officers on duty in the Rambewa area of Anuradhapura this morning.

data.title: Govt. reviews ‚ÄòAswesuma‚Äô welfare benefits programme
data.byline: The government has initiated a comprehensive review of the ‚ÄúAswesuma‚Äù welfare benefits programme  to ensure inclusivity and fairness, Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning Harshana Suriyapperuma said in Parliament today (21).

data.title: Sri Lanka to revisit IMF agreement?
data.byline: The government plans to revisit the International Monetary Fund (IMF) agreement to provide additional relief measures for the public, Deputy Minister of Finance Harshana Suriyapperuma said in Parliament today (21).

data.title: Govt will uphold existing Anti-Terrorism Bill until new law is passed: Minister
data.byline: Leader of the House, Minister Bimal Rathnayake states that the existing Anti-Terrorism Bill would be upheld with great caution until a new legislation is enacted.

data.title: Colombo HC postpones ‚ÄòSathosa‚Äô case against Johnston Fernando
data.byline: The Colombo High Court today (21) ordered that the case filed against former Minister Johnston Fernando and two others to be taken up on June 03 for further hearing of evidence.

data.title: Polonnaruwa-Manampitiya train service suspended
data.byline: The Railway Department has announced that the temporary train service between Polonnaruwa and Manampitiya has been suspended as of this morning (21).

data.title: Immigration officer arrested while accepting bribe
data.byline: An Immigration and Emigration Authorized Officer has been apprehended on Monday (20) for allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs. 500,000 at the Welisara Detention Center.

data.title: World Bank assures financial and technical assistance for Sri Lanka‚Äôs key govt projects
data.byline: Vice President for South Asia at the World Bank Martin Raiser stated that the organization is committed to providing financial and technical assistance for Sri Lanka‚Äôs key government projects.

data.title: S&P SL20 crosses 5,000 and ASPI surpasses 16,500 for first time
data.byline: The indices of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) reached historic milestones today (January 21) as the All Share Price Index (ASPI) surpassed the 16,500-points mark and the S&P SL20 crossed 5,000 points for the first time in the capital market‚Äôs history.

data.title: Cabinet greenlights Proceeds of Crime Draft Bill
data.byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to publish the Proceeds of Crime Draft Bill in the Government Gazette and subsequently, to submit it to the Parliament for its concurrence.

data.title: Sri Lanka‚Äôs inflation drops to -2.0% in December 2024
data.byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the National Consumer Price Index (NCPI) on Year-on-Year basis has decreased to -2.0% in December 2024, from -1.7% in November 2024, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

data.title: Ex-Minister Manusha leaves CID after giving 6-hour statement
data.byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara has left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) after recording a statement.

data.title: Kandy-Mahiyanganaya road section to be closed during the night
data.byline: The stretch of road near the 18 Hairpin Bends (18 Wanguwa) on the Kandy - Mahiyanganaya road will be temporarily closed for traffic near Kahatagolla from 6.00 p.m. to 6.00 a.m. daily until further notice.

data.title: Court order issued over MP Ramanathan Archchuna
data.byline: The Anuradhapura Magistrate‚Äôs Court has ordered the police to act under existing laws with regard to Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna and to investigate the incident involving his alleged obstruction of police duties and traffic violations in Anuradhapura.

data.title: Army Major, 6 other ranks, policeman and 15 others arrested over recent organised crimes
data.byline: An Army Major, six other ranks, a policeman and 15 others allegedly engaged in organised crimes have been arrested over recently reported crimes, Minister of  Public Security Ananda Wijepala informs the Parliament today (21).

data.title: Turkish ski resort fire kills 66, forces guests to jump from windows
data.byline: A fire at a ski resort hotel in Turkey‚Äôs Bolu mountains killed 66 people on Tuesday and forced panicked guests to jump out of windows in the middle of the night.

data.title: 2025 Budget to engage every segment of population in economic process - President
data.byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that this year‚Äôs budget will be prepared with the objective of involving every segment of the population in the country‚Äôs economic processes.

data.title: Suspect arrested with nearly 2 kg of ‚ÄòIce‚Äô in Hanwella
data.byline: Police have arrested a suspect along with nearly 2 kilograms of ‚ÄòIce‚Äô drugs (Crystal Methamphetamine) in the Niripola area of the Hanwella police division this afternoon (21).

data.title: Heavy showers above 100 mm expected in parts of the island
data.byline: The Meteorology Department says rainy condition is expected to continue further for the next 24 hours in Northern, North-central, Eastern, Uva and Central provinces.

data.title: 14 injured as bus topples in Serunuwara
data.byline: A private passenger bus travelling from Kattankudy to Colombo has reportedly been involved in an accident this morning (20) near the bend in front of the Kallar army camp in the Serunuwara area on the Serunuwara-Kantale road, within the Serunuwara Police Division.

data.title: Fire burns through multiple tents at Hindu festival in India but causes no injuries
data.byline: A fire tore through at least 18 temporary tents at a massive Hindu festival thronged by millions of people in India‚Äôs northern Prayagraj city, officials said Sunday. There were no injuries.

data.title: TikTok restores service for US users based on Trump‚Äôs promised executive order
data.byline: TikTok restored service to users in the United States on Sunday just hours after the popular video-sharing platform went dark in response to a federal ban, which President-elect Donald Trump said he would try to pause by executive order on his first day in office.

data.title: Census of low-income families for second phase of ‚ÄòAswesuma‚Äô to begin tomorrow
data.byline: The Welfare Benefits Board says that the census of low-income families who have applied for the second phase of the ‚ÄúAswesuma‚Äù welfare benefits programme will commence tomorrow (21).

data.title: Israel frees 90 Palestinian prisoners as ceasefire takes hold after Hamas returns 3 Israeli hostages
data.byline: The first three hostages were released from Gaza and the first Palestinian prisoners were freed from Israeli custody as the fragile ceasefire between Israel and Hamas took hold following 15 months of war, with mixed emotions and more difficult steps ahead over the next six weeks.

data.title: Sri Lanka welcomes Gaza ceasefire agreement
data.byline: Sri Lanka has welcomed the recent ceasefire agreement in Gaza, which has brought an end to the 15-month long conflict between Israel and Hamas.

data.title: Sri Lanka‚Äôs economic sectors gear up for further growth in early 2025
data.byline: Sri Lanka‚Äôs Purchasing Managers‚Äô Index (PMI) for December 2024 recorded growth in both manufacturing and services sectors.

data.title: CBSL to launch new investment tranche with advanced strategies, prioritizing foreign reserves
data.byline: With projections indicating historically high levels of inflows from the services trade and workers‚Äô remittances, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) plans to capitalize on market opportunities through diversified strategies across various markets.

data.title: UK tea experts explore trading opportunities with Sri Lankan specialty tea producers
data.byline: A delegation of experts and specialists from the UK tea industry is in Sri Lanka this week to strengthen connections with the country‚Äôs specialty tea producers and explore business opportunities.

data.title: Instagram rolls out TikTok-like features amid uncertainty about rival‚Äôs future
data.byline: Instagram has rolled out a number of updates in recent days that appear to be aimed at attracting TikTok users while the short-video app‚Äôs future remains in limbo.

data.title: Get ready for world‚Äôs first trillionaires: Musk, Bezos and Zuckerberg to cross the line first
data.byline: Move over billionaires. The first trillionaires are on their way.

Vehicle prices will rise initially, then gradually decrease: President
data.byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayaka said yesterday that though there will be a price increase upon resuming vehicle imports in February, after a five-year pause, the prices will gradually decrease depending on market behaviour.

data.title: Coconut chamber urges govt. to import 200 Mn nuts to prevent crisis
data.byline: The Ceylon Chamber of Coconut Industries (CCCI), the umbrella organisation for Sri Lanka‚Äôs coconut industry, yesterday urged the government to expedite the proposal to import 200 million nuts urgently to avert a looming dual crisis.

data.title: Bishop asks Trump to show mercy to LGBT people and migrants
data.byline: The direct appeal to President Trump at the start of the first full day of his presidency was a remarkable moment at a National Cathedral event that traditionally has not been political.

data.title: President says no personal revenge in reclaiming former presidents‚Äô residences
data.byline: The issue of handing over the Presidential residence came to the forefront when the government started fulfilling its election promises. However, this is not a personal issue or an act of revenge against anyone, President Anura Kumara Dissanayaka said in a television programme last night.

data.title: Over 12,000 traffic violations identified via CCTV in Colombo
data.byline: Since February last year, a total of 12,918 motorists have been identified for violating traffic rules through the CCTV system in Colombo.

data.title: December inflation records 2% YoY dip, extending deflationary trend to fourth consecutive month
data.byline: Sri Lanka‚Äôs National Consumer Price Index (NCPI) recorded a 2.0 percent year-on-year decline in December 2024, extending the deflationary trend to its fourth consecutive month.

data.title: Tourist arrivals cross 100,000 mark within first 2 weeks of January
data.byline: Tourist arrival crossed the 100,000 mark within the first two weeks of January, recording a Year-on-Year (YoY) increase of 22 percent.

data.title: WHO ‚Äôregrets‚Äô Trump decision to pull US from organisation
data.byline: The World Health Organization said Tuesday it regretted US President Donald Trump‚Äôs decision ‚Äî just hours after taking power ‚Äî to withdraw his country from the UN agency, saying it hoped he would ‚Äô‚Äôreconsider.‚Äô‚Äô

data.title: Why did Western Province Governor fund illumination of Galle Face during Christmas, asks MP
data.byline: Opposition MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake questioned in Parliament today as to why Western Province Governor Hanif Yusoof funded Christmas light displays at Galle Face and Duplication Road.

data.title: No evidence to prove I engaged in human trafficking: Manusha
data.byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara said today that there is no evidence to prove he had engaged in human trafficking.

data.title: FCID to be launched next week: Public Security Minister
data.byline: The Financial Crime Investigation Division (FCID) will be established next week to handle cases related to financial crimes, Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said in Parliament.

data.title: Mahinda facing mudslinging, but lions don‚Äôt whine: Ven. Saddatissa Thera
data.byline: A mudslinging campaign is underway against former President Mahinda Rajapaksa and everyone is saying that he is whining. But lions do not whine like puppies do, Ven. Iththakande Saddatissa thera said.

data.title: Several politicians linked to company which supplied Papaverine injection at higher prices: Nalinda
data.byline: Claiming that several polticians are linked to the comapny which had supplied Papaverine injection at an exorbinat price from 2019 to 2023, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today that an investigation will be conducted into the incident.

data.title: MP Archchuna Ramanathan to be arrested?
data.byline: The Anuradhapura Magistrate‚Äôs Court ordered the police to carry out further investigations into the incident involving MP Archchuna Ramanathan who allegedly obstructed the duties of police personnel in the Rambewa area of Anuradhapura, the police spokesman said.

data.title: Bribery Commission files 75 cases under new Anti-Corruption Act
data.byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption announced that it has filed approximately 75 court cases under the newly enacted Anti-Corruption Act within the past nine months.

data.title: STF arrests suspect with ICE, cash in Hanwella
data.byline: The Police Special Task Force (STF) arrested a suspect in Hanwella, seizing nearly two kilograms of ICE narcotic, valued at Rs. 35 million, along with Rs. 100,000 in cash.

data.title: Over 380 elephants killed in 2024
data.byline: Sri Lanka witnessed the death of 386 elephants in 2024 due to an array of causes, according to the Department of Wildlife Conservation.

data.title: Cabinet approval granted to provide Rs. 3,000 gift voucher for school children, student monks
data.byline: The Cabinet approved a Rs. 3,000 gift voucher for selected schoolchildren, student monks, and lay students in Pirivenas to purchase shoes and to Seela Mathas, Health and Mass Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

data.title: Cabinet approves new appointments to key government posts
data.byline: The Cabinet of Ministers approved the appointment of two Commissioners to the Lands and Agriculture sectors and the Director General for the Department of Civil Defense.

data.title: Bi-partial civil aviation agreement between Sri Lanka, Italy
data.byline: The Cabinet approved a proposal to sign a bi-partial civil aviation agreement between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Italy to operate air passenger services and air cargo services, Cabinet spoksman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

data.title: Immigration official arrested for soliciting Rs. half-million bribe
data.byline: An immigration officer from the Department of Immigration and Emigration has been arrested for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs. 500,000 to secure the release of an individual detained over a visa violation.

data.title: Fire at ski resort hotel kills 10, injures 32
data.byline: A fire erupted early Tuesday at a hotel in a popular Turkish ski resort in the northwestern province of Bolu, killing 10 people and injuring 32,  Agence France-Presse reported, citing the interior ministry.

data.title: Ready to probe obtaining Rs. 50 mn to offer Parliamentary seat, if complained: Justice Minister
data.byline: A certain political party has obtained Rs. 50 million from a person to offer him a Parliamentary seat and the government is ready to investigate into it if a complaint is lodged, Justice Minister Harshana Nanayakkara said today.

data.title: Gammanpila questions President‚Äôs remarks on Trincomalee oil tanks

data.title: Court directs Tissa Attanayake to respond to PM‚Äôs defamation claim
